critique: This document pertains to the administration and operation of the Panama Canal during 1944. It authorizes the Governor of The Panama Canal to contract with the Panama Railroad Company for the operation of certain piers and docks. Given the limited scope and specific nature of the order, it's difficult to assign strong scores on most of the axes. The document does not directly address ideological issues, immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It has a slight impact on economic regulation and federalism, and potentially executive power.
